COVER LETTER & RESUME

Rafael Medina

Product Designer

ABOUT ME

Hello design team folks at Doist,


Raised in a small town in the Dominican Republic. From an early age, I loved the idea of building things and helping to create products and services.


Nowadays, I am a product designer building and scaling stuff for my clients. I love what I do, and the contributions I have made to my clients earned me a respectable designer's profile. However, indeed "great just isn't good enough."; there is something fundamental missing when you work independently; the feeling of growth alongside others.

WHY DOIST?

I believe that as a Doist Product Designer I would have the opportunity to create real value for millions of people building the future. Besides, working in a company as forward-thinking and diverse as Doist would allow me to continue doing what I most like, namely facing new challenges on a regular basis and working out innovative solutions.


Finally, I am just a big fan of Doist and it’s different products. I like its history (it's being born with humble beginnings), and I share it’s core principle.

WHY ME?

I fill many boxes out of this position:


Development: I do have an experience and education background as a dev.


Design: I've been designing since 2010 when I started working in highschool.


Remote: Being remote for a long time. I've learned a lot of tricks.


Human: I like to do illustrations and photography in my spare time for fun.


Adaptability: I've moved far from my comfort zone to be where I am now.


Awards: I've won multiple awards, hackathons and full by scholarships.

Altogether, I am convinced that my strong background, enthusiasm, and commitment would be of great value to Doist.

— Rafael Medina

 

EXPERTISE & SKILLS

Inventing effective ways for people to interact with products.

- Wireframing & Prototyping

Designing simple and user-friendly solutions for web and mobile.

Front-end development

Developing and prototyping responsive websites and web applications.

- HTML (Pug), CSS (PostCSS)
- GreenSock (JS animations)
- Jekyll & ReactJS

UI/UX, Mobile, Android, Material Design

UX, Web Design, Illustration

Cobblestone was an API format converter for mortgage applications that solved by transforming their forms input data into every data storage format. SEE MORE

Unicorn. —

UI/UX, Mobile, Animation

Unicorn works as an interactive form with geo maps and digital signature to get your loan information and have it printed quickly and make it a pleasurable experience.
